part.narration: The first wave of employees is here! Yuki takes a look at the candidates in the waiting area and grins.
part.line: You are all among the first in Sega's equal opportunity employment effort.
Sorry we don't take resume sumissions. I'd rather see your smiling faces.
part.narration: Name and occupation flashes in the user interface below a candidate's face.Graphics Programmer Kyou Hayate grimaces and scoffs.
Graphics Programmer Claude Guillemot superhero-poses on his chair.
Texture Artist Clarisse Bernadette, plain and old, unassuming and unarousing, struggles to enunciate her name.
User Interface Designer Capucine Rousseau yawns and looks up from her watch.

Network Programmer Kenneth Anderson shatters expectations brought by his ebony complexion, his enthusiasm aiding him in faking a Japanese accent surpassing any right-hair's. He tries to sneak in as many particles as possible. Don't they sound great?
